cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 mi (415 km) SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the Yucatán Peninsula, then forecast to enter the central Gulf of Mexico Sunday–Monday and arc north-northwest toward the northwest Gulf Coast (TX–LA border area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas or south-central Louisiana coast (near TX/LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatán Peninsula, then northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward through Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds (35–45 mph, higher gusts) possible late Tue night–Wed as the center nears the upper TX coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early NHC surge guidance not yet issued for Texas, but 2–4 ft inundation above ground level is possible on the upper Texas coast, including Sabine Lake, if the forecast track shifts closer.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 3–6 inches of rain with localized higher totals as the system makes landfall and moves inland over eastern Texas/western Louisiana.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief coastal flooding and hazardous seas could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations in the Sabine–Neches Waterway.
